newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves IPCL foreign bond plans.
newsitem.headline: India approves IPCL foreign bond plans.

text.p: The Indian government on Thursday said it had approved plans of Indian Petrochemicals Corporation Ltd (IPCL) to raise $175 million through issue of foreign currency convertible bonds.
"The company will take a decision about the pricing and timing of the new foreign currency convertible bonds (FCCBs) in consultation with the lead managers," a government statement said.
The state-controlled IPCL is setting up a grassroot petrochemical company in the western state of Gujarat and expanding its gas cracker unit in Baroda.
"The government, even after the issue of these FCCBs by IPCL, would continue to be the majority shareholder," the statement said.
